info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 20 at 12:21AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL HARNETT...NORTHEASTERN LEE...SOUTHERN WAKE AND SOUTHEASTERN CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 1220 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Cary to New Hill to 10 miles southeast of Pittsboro, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail around New Hill and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Angier, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale and Wendell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
